extendedInfo.description: This version of the App is for PRE JELLY BEAN versions on Android. (Below v 4.10)The Steve Dahl Podcast Network is a growing web of podcasts led by broadcasting legend and podcasting pioneer, Steve Dahl.Created in 2011, the network now includes fellow Midwestern and radio personalities Kevin Matthews, James VanOsdol and comedy writer & actor Dino Stamatopoulos.Subscribers to the network benefit from daily shows from Steve Dahl, biweekly shows from Kevin Matthews and over 30 years of radio archives. The podcasts are uncensored shows and content ranges from sports to local Chicago life to pop culture â nothing is off limits. Subscribers have the benefit of being able to listen to these podcasts anywhere they have access to a computer or a personal listening device. The network continues to grow and there are new show ideas in production with notable names in entertainment and comedy.

reviews.title: login
reviews.comment: How do I set up a login name or password?

reviews.title: Great content.
reviews.comment: Dahl is the best, app is not great on android but Steve & Dag are awesome.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Photon 4G, Galaxy Tab 2
reviews.comment: Old app was bssic but so much easier to use. Still works grest on my Photon. Opens on Tab 2 and closes after 3 seconds. The Adam Carolla app is really the way a podcast \"network\" should be done.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Much better, but...
reviews.comment: Once the show downloads, it\'s a much better experience. A downside is that there is no streaming or playing of partial episodes. If the download loses connectivity, even for a second, you have to restart manually. It usually takes me many attempts to get an episode. I understand that a WiFi connection is the best, but they do cal l them \"mobile devices\" They should work when you are in your car or away from home.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Love the network
reviews.comment: Great shows!  Love that I can  listen on the drive to work, pause the show and continue listening in the office.  I don\'t miss a moment and don\'t have to put up with tons of lame commercials.
reviews.author: A Google User
